Precompiled Libraries

Included page: .FlexOvl.BasicOsgpFunctions.SetUp (edit)

import
com.alliander.osgp.platform.acceptancetests

script
start scoped giv wen zen for slim basicfunctions Test not run

Narrative

In order to make installed devices communicate in a secure way, sequence numbers are present in the protocol.
This prevents replay-attacks.
The device will register once every 24 hours. The device generates a random sequence number and a random value 'randomDevice'.
The platform will receive the register request and will use the same sequence number and 'randomDevice' value and the platform will generate a random value 'randomPlatform' to create a response.
The device will receive the response and will issue a confirm device registration request, using an incremented sequence number, along with the 'randomDevice' and 'randomPlatform' values.

Note

The sequence number has a range of 0 to 65535 (2^16 - 1).
The two random values 'randomDevice' and 'randomPlatform' have the same range.
The sequence number window has a value of 6.

Scenario: Register device that already exists on the platform.

script
given a valid register device OSLP message
and an existing device with initial sequence number
when the register device request is received
then the device should contain an expected - equal to init - sequence number
and the device should have both random values set

Scenario: Confirm device registration.

script
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message
and an existing device with incremented sequence number
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should contain an expected - incremented - sequence number

Scenario: Confirm device registration using sequence number, sequence number window range is 6.

scenario sequence_number_matrix sequenceNumber isAltered
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number @sequenceNumber
and an existing device with wrong sequence number @sequenceNumber
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered @isAltered and contain an expected sequence number @sequenceNumber

sequence_number_matrix
sequenceNumber isAltered
1 true
scenario sequence_number_matrix sequenceNumber isAltered
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number 1
and an existing device with wrong sequence number 1
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered true and contain an expected sequence number 1
2 true

given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number 2
and an existing device with wrong sequence number 2
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered true and contain an expected sequence number 2
3 true

given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number 3
and an existing device with wrong sequence number 3
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered true and contain an expected sequence number 3
4 true

5 true

given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number 5
and an existing device with wrong sequence number 5
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered true and contain an expected sequence number 5
6 true
scenario sequence_number_matrix sequenceNumber isAltered
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number 6
and an existing device with wrong sequence number 6
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered true and contain an expected sequence number 6
7 true
scenario sequence_number_matrix sequenceNumber isAltered
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number 7
and an existing device with wrong sequence number 7
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered true and contain an expected sequence number 7
8 false
scenario sequence_number_matrix sequenceNumber isAltered
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number 8
and an existing device with wrong sequence number 8
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered false and contain an expected sequence number 8
9 false
scenario sequence_number_matrix sequenceNumber isAltered
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number 9
and an existing device with wrong sequence number 9
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered false and contain an expected sequence number 9
10 false
scenario sequence_number_matrix sequenceNumber isAltered
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message with sequence number 10
and an existing device with wrong sequence number 10
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should be altered false and contain an expected sequence number 10


Scenario: Confirm device registration when 'randomPlatform' value is incorrect or missing.

script
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message
and an existing device with incremented sequence number
when the confirm device registration request is received but the randomPlatform value is incorrectly saved or set or missing
then the device should not be altered and contain an expected - incremented - sequence number

Scenario: Confirm device registration when 'randomDevice' value is incorrect or missing.

script
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message
and an existing device with incremented sequence number
when the confirm device registration request is received but the randomDevice is incorrectly saved or set or missing
then the device should not be altered and contain an expected - incremented - sequence number
